Well, I'm sure people are getting weary of hearing us go on about this
particular topic so I'll just say one last thing on it.

- One can recreate any arbitrary circuit with a static neural network (in case
there is any doubt about this, try creating a NAND gate).

- Therefore, one can recreate a computer with a neural network.
- A computer can be programmed to learn.
- Therefore, a static neural network can learn.

Unless there is some error in that logic, I'm not sure what the real issue is.
 If we could refrain from talking about nebulous concepts like constructive
signal reinforcement in the brain, that would really make this easier for me
too.  Thanks, regards,

jeff
